data.title: Eleanor Powys
data.text:
Birth13 Feb 1773, St George, Hanover Sq parish, London

Baptism16 Mar 1773, St George Hanover Sq parish church, Middlesex

Death10 Dec 1854, Kettering district, Northants

Burial16 Dec 1854, Barton-Seagrave, Northamptons

General1st dau. and 1st child. 3rd cousin once removed of her husband.

FatherThomas Powys Lord Lilford (1743-1800)

MotherEleanor Mann (1747-1823)

Notes for Eleanor Powys

Her baptism transcription:

First name(s) Eleanor

Last name Powys

Birth year 1773

Mother's first name(s) Eleanor

Parish St George, Hanover Square

County Middlesex

Page 144

Archive City of Westminster Archives Centre

Record set Westminster Baptisms

And the Baptism register actually read, from the page found, thanks, on Ancestry:

“Baptisms March 1773

“. . . .

“16 [day of March] Eleranor D. of Thomas Esqr. & Eleanor Powys. 13 Feb [birth]”

___________________

LDS Vital records:

On 9 March 1814, in Clun Shropshire, a James Powys was christened, mother Elinor Powys, father not entered. Might this be her? There are two other candidates for this Elinor.

On 25 Jan 1823 also in Clun, Shropshire, an Elizabeth Powys was born to John Powys and Betsy. There is also an Elizabeth who appears in the 1881 census in Rickmansworth, born in Shropshire.

On 10 November 1844, again in Clun Shropshire, a Mary Powys was born to John Powys and Jane. I think these three births must be relations, somehow.

__________________

Oswald Barron, in his VCH genealogy volume for Northants, calls here Helena. As yet I have found no records to support this.

___________________

Their children are, from a search for baptisms from 1801 to 1821 on Ancestry with the surname of Stopford and parents’ forenames of Richard and Eleanor:

___________________
